column4: yeah-- I hit ctrl-alt-f1 (i think that is what you had said) and i got a text screen, then some messages saying a bunch of services were shutting down, then the system hung
well i never made it into terminal
the thing is, i'm now booted off of the cd and am not sure how to access my ubuntu file structure on the hdd
i've got a terminal up now and ran sudo nano with no probs
but how do i load the relevant xconf file on my hdd?

okay, let me ask you this before i try learning something more new: is there a way to simply start from scratch with feisty-- before I screwed it all up?  when i try to install again from the cd, it wants to further partition my hdd rather than just installing over the partition it already made for ubuntu
or are you using the live cd?
what was the X error? the to find it, there's like a blue screen appear when X can't load right? try finding the culprit there
try the nvidia settings, download it @ synaptic
try nvidia even though the card i've got is an ati radeon?
have you tried manually configuring your xorg.conf?
in the screen section, subsection display, depth 24 modes "1680x1050"
vesa drivers doesn't support your resolution. install the ati driver
